definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: You can tell he is a parvenu.
sentences.chinese: 你看他财大气粗，就知道他是个暴发户。

sentences.english: I find myself feeling like either a deep-pocketed patsy or a skinflint.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己好像是一个财大气粗的帕齐或者是吝啬鬼。

sentences.english: The sums involved were small beer for a behemoth like GE.
sentences.chinese: 涉及金额对财大气粗的通用来说不过是九牛一毛。

sentences.english: As we all know, the tobacco industry is ruthless, devious, rich, and powerful.
sentences.chinese: 众所周知，烟草业财大气粗，狡猾无情。

definition: lit. stake a thousand pieces of gold on one throw (idiom); to throw away money recklessly/extravagant
to spare no effort/to devote all one's energies
lit. to squander money like dirt (idiom)/fig. to spend money like water/extravagant
having wealth equivalent to that of an entire nation (idiom)/extremely wealthy
sth written or painted in one's own hand/(of a writer, calligrapher or painter) skill/style/hand/(fig.) style shown in spending money, handling business etc/scale
